sets.name: Assault Vest
sets.description:
• Azumarill distinguishes itself as a Water-type with its access to Superpower, Fairy-type STAB moves, and priority Aqua Jet.
  • Superpower lets Assault Vest Azumarill defeat most Iron Bundle and most Magnezone.
  • Aqua Jet finishes off low health foes and allows Azumarill to outplay Disable users like Dragapult and Iron Valiant and Sturdy Pokemon like Magnezone and Counter Donphan.
  • The HP and Special Defense EVs, along with Assault Vest and a Careful nature, allow Azumarill to defeat Timid Choice Specs Iron Moth and non-Thunder Choice Specs Magnezone.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Superpower gives Azumarill good chances to defeat Speed-boosting Booster Energy Iron Bundle.
  • Aqua Jet OHKOes Iron Moth, while Fling lets Azumarill remove its Choice Band to avoid losing to Disable Dragapult.
  • The Special Defense investment, HP investment, and a Careful nature allow Azumarill to defeat most Iron Bundle.
  • Alternatively, an EV spread of 104 HP / 160 Atk / 244 Def with an Impish nature lets it defeat Chien-Pao, but this spread is less reliable versus Iron Bundle.

sets.name: Stall
sets.description:
• Chilling Water allows Azumarill to chip the foe down while reducing their Attack, giving it better chances versus Taunt Great Tusk.
  • Sap Sipper lures in Grass-types such as most offensive Choice Band Meowscarada.
  • The HP, Special Defense investment, and Calm nature allow Azumarill to defeat Timid Choice Specs Iron Valiant most of the time.
  • Use Charm or Amnesia to lower the foe's damage output until Azumarill is forced to use Rest.

sets.name: Endeavor
sets.description:
• Sturdy and Sitrus Berry allow Donphan to always get a Substitute up. This allows Donphan to beat Choice item Pokemon like Meowscarada and Chien-Pao, regardless of whether they go for an OHKO or not.
  • Earthquake is Donphan's strongest STAB move, beating Pokemon like Magnezone and Clodsire.
  • EVs are put into Attack and Defense to deal the most damage and help with physical attackers, since physical attacks rarely activate Sturdy.
  • 0 Speed IVs allow Donphan to be as slow as possible, which lets Substitute be used after slow threats like Dondozo and Garganacl move, creating a free turn to use Endeavor or Substitute again. 0 Special Defense IVs are used to activate Sturdy more often.
  • Donphan should almost always use Substitute turn 1. Donphan should continue to use it until its HP does not allow it to do so, proceeding to use Endeavor + Ice Shard to go for the KO.
  • An exception to this rule is that if Donphan can 2HKO with a combination Earthquake and Ice Shard, it should do that instead, such as against Choice item Dragapult, Magnezone, and Clodsire.

sets.name: Rocky Helmet
sets.description:
• Protect scouts Choice item users like Dragapult and Choice Specs Iron Bundle, leaving them open to Disable.

  • Encore handles setup Pokemon like Curse Dondozo as well as stall sets like Azumarill's.

  • Recover is especially useful against recoil move users like Talonflame and Arcanine.

  • Minimum Speed is run for opposing Sableye to guaranteed a slower Struggle.

  • Sableye should always use Protect turn one and then Encore against status moves or Disable against attacks. If Encore is used, the correct sequence is Encore > Protect > Disable > Encore and heal with Recover as necessary. Encore can also be used against weak attacks that have no chance of KOing Sableye. Sableye should also use Disable while the foe is using Struggle in order to conserve Recover's few PP against foes with Leftovers or other forms of recovery.

  • If Disable is used first, use Encore and Recover while the foe is stuck with Struggle. Since Recover has low PP, it should only be used when Sableye could faint to a critical hit.

sets.name: Trick + Disable
sets.description:
• Trick gives the foe Sableye's Choice Scarf, allowing Sableye to use Disable and force it into using Struggle. This allows Sableye to beat threats like Dondozo, Iron Hands, and Donphan.

  • Fling gets rid of any unwanted items, such as a given Assault Vest and Sableye's Choice Scarf.

  • Recover allows Sableye to heal off damage dealt while stalling its foe.

  • 252 HP and Defense EVs with an Impish nature maximize Sableye's physical bulk.

  • Sableye should almost always use Trick turn 1 and Disable turn 2, then repeatedly use Recover until the foe faints from Struggle recoil.

  • An exception to this is with Choice item Pokemon like Choice Band Dondozo and Donphan, where Sableye should use Fling turn 1 and Disable turn 2, then spam Recover.

  • Sableye struggles to beat Encore and Taunt users, like Annihilape and Skeledirge, and Pokemon that OHKO it, like Iron Valiant and Sylveon. Additionally, Sableye can not defeat Dark-types such as Meowscarada and Ting-Lu, due to its status moves not affecting them.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description:
• Hyper Beam OHKOes Ting-Lu, Dondozo, non-Assault Vest Azumarill, and non-specially defensive Bellibolt.
  • Hyper Voice allows Sylveon to bypass Substitute from Leech Seed Meowscarada, Dragapult, and Petaya Berry Espathra. Hyper Voice also has perfect Accuracy and lets Sylveon beat slower Sylveon variants.
  • Psyshock allows Sylveon to beat Clodsire and occasionally Life Orb Salazzle.
  • Shadow Ball 2HKOes Skeledirge.
  • The Speed EVs are for Sylveon to outspeed Pokemon with 50 base Speed unless if they use a Speed boosting nature.
  • Against Espathra, Sylveon should always use Hyper Voice for the best chance to win against most Espathra. Unlike other Sylveon sets, Choice Specs loses to Encore + Disable Iron Valiant.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Outrage is Dragapult's strongest move. It can defeat foes like Meowscarada and deal great damage against neutral enemies, such as Arcanine and Bellibolt.
  • Dragon Darts handles foes that may use Haban Berry, like Salamence and Garchomp.
  • Phantom Force defeats some Ghost-types like Skeledirge.
  • U-turn defeats Booster Energy Brute Bonnet, unless it raises Attack with Booster Energy.
  • Infiltrator enables Dragapult to win against Espathra.
  • Clear Body allows Dragapult to win against stall Azumarill, bulky Salamence, and stall Arcanine.
  • Being Adamant enables Dragapult to defeat Air Balloon and Booster Energy Iron Hands, the latter if it raises Attack with Booster Energy.
  • If running Jolly, Dragapult can outspeed Booster Energy Iron Bundle if it does not raise its Speed with Booster Energy.
  • Usually Dragapult should use its strongest move against the foe, but in the Annihilape matchup, Dragapult can win against some sets if it uses Outrage on the first turn, instead of Phantom Force, and Annihilape uses Bulk Up.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Meowscarada utilizes its amazing Speed, great Attack stat, Protean, and Choice Band to cement itself as a great Pokemon within the tier.
  • Flower Trick allows Meowscarada to handle Water-, Ground-, and Rock-types like Dondozo, Ting-Lu, and Garganacl.
  • Knock Off is a great option for hitting Ghost- and Psychic-types such as non-Choice Scarf Gholdengo and Espathra. It is also useful for dealing with Magnezone, preventing Meowscarada from being OHKOed by a Choice Specs-boosted Hyper Beam.
  • Sucker Punch can be used to OHKO Choice item Dragapult and Flutter Mane; however this requires prediction in regards to the latter and is generally an inferior option to Knock Off.
  • Giga Impact is Meowscarada's strongest move at its disposal, letting it take on threats such as Sylveon and Clodsire.
  • Play Rough hits Dragon- and Fighting-types like Goodra, Garchomp, and Gallade.
  • Other options include moves like Thunder Punch and Shadow Claw, which beats stall Azumarill and Counter Annihilape, respectively.
  • Alternatively, Meowscarada can opt to run a Leech Seed set with Substitute, Protect, Leech Seed, and Flower Trick with an EV spread of 240 HP / 16 Def / 252 Spe and Mental Herb to have a more reliable matchup against Annihilape, Iron Hands, and non-Timid Flutter Mane.
  • Against Pokemon that can tank a hit from Meowscarada, like Iron Hands and Great Tusk, it is best to use moves that won't make Meowscarada vulnerable to the opposing Pokemon's attacks. Using Flower Trick on Iron Hands can let you win the one-on-one against it, as your opponent may predict Meowscarada turning into a Fairy-type and use Heavy Slam; this also applies to non-Speed Booster Energy and Choice Scarf Great Tusk, where Meowscarada may need to use Play Rough on a predicted Close Combat or Flower Trick on a Headlong Rush.
  • Be wary against Donphan, Meowscarada fails to deal with its Sturdy and Counter.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
• Flower Trick OHKOes non-defensive Azumarill and Sandy Shocks and beats Rotom-Wash.
  • Knock Off OHKOes Dragapult and defeats Espathra, Iron Leaves, and non-Metal Burst Sableye.
  • Play Rough hits Iron Valiant, Roaring Moon, and opposing Meowscarada.
  • Low Kick OHKOes Chien-Pao, Tyranitar, and non-Chople Berry Kingambit.
  • Giga Impact OHKOes non-defensive Volcarona and Iron Moth.
  • Trick can potentially catch bulky Pokemon like Endeavor Donphan and Corviknight off-guard by locking them into a useless move.
  • Choice Scarf Meowscarada should be used against fast and frail Pokemon it can OHKO with a super effective move, like Dragapult, Espathra, and Hisuian Zoroark, or Pokemon it can 2HKO and survive a hit from Protean's type change, like Iron Valiant and Walking Wake.

sets.name: Clear Amulet
sets.description:
• Clear Amulet blocks the Special Defense drops from Sylveon's Fake Tears, Iron Moth's and Goodra's Acid Spray, and Magnezone's Metal Sound. Additionally, it also blocks the Special Attack drops from Bellibolt's Eerie Impulse and Walking Wake's Snarl.
  • Calm Mind + Roost lets Espathra outlast and beat Sylveon, Magnezone, and Timid Choice Specs or Modest non-Choice Specs Iron Moth.
  • Stored Power is the best damaging move for this set, as it pairs well with Calm Mind and Speed Boost to outdamage Bellibolt, Walking Wake, and Farigiraf. Clear Amulet prevents foes from lowering its power by removing Espathra's stat boosts.
  • Protect gives Espathra a more reliable matchup against Modest Choice Specs Iron Moth, while Feather Dance lets Espathra beat Choice Band Dondozo and Choice Band Donphan.
  • The general strategy with Clear Amulet Espathra is using the combination of Calm Mind, Protect or Feather Dance, and Speed Boost to increase Espathra's defensive capabilities, damage output, and Speed. Against Sylveon, for example, Espathra should use Calm Mind on the first turn and continue to use it until Espathra needs to use Roost, or until Stored Power will 2HKO Sylveon.
  • If running Protect, Espathra can use it on the first turn to procure a Speed boost. This, for example, is useful against Iron Moth, as Modest Choice Specs variants might OHKO with Overheat if Espathra can't use Calm Mind beforehand. After this, however, Espathra can return to its general strategy to KO Iron Moth with Stored Power.

sets.name: Roseli Berry
sets.description:
• Defiant lets Annihilape counter stat-lowering strategies, such as Arcanine's Intimidate and Charm Azumarill.

  • Roseli Berry lets Annihilape beat Fairy-types that it usually struggles or outright can't win against, such as Sylveon and Azumarill, along with Pokemon with Fairy coverage such as Play Rough + Choice Band Meowscarada.

  • Bulk Up allows Annihilape to survive longer and boost Rage Fist's power, both by boosting Attack and taking hits, in front of foes such as Donphan.

  • Gunk Shot is Annihilape's strongest move against most Fairy-types, such as Azumarill and Sylveon.

  • Drain Punch nails Dark types, such as Ting-Lu and Chien Pao, alongside giving recovery against foes such as Donphan and Weakness Policy Ting-Lu.

  • Counter can OHKO physical attackers Annihilape cannot damage easily, such as non-Swords Dance Iron Hands and Azumarill.

  • Taunt and Encore are both used to disrupt various strategies. Taunt is better in denying offensive setup from foes, like opposing Annihilape, and blocking slower Taunt or Encore users such as uninvested Corviknight and Donphan. Encore better punishes defensive setup, such as Garganacl's Iron Defense and stall Arcanine.

  • Annihilape's last moveslot comes with a lot of opportunity costs. Removing Drain Punch gives harder matchups against Dark-types like Ting-Lu. Not slotting Counter forces it to hit physical Fairy-types like Azumarill and Play Rough Meowscarada with Gunk Shot, which has lower accuracy.

  • The HP and Special Defense investment with a Careful nature allows Annihilape to survive a Hyper Beam from Modest Choice Specs Sylveon. 116 Atk EVs let it 2HKO most Sylveon with Gunk Shot turn 1 and Rage Fist turn 2, minimizing miss chances. The remaining EVs are put in Speed to outspeed Modest Sylveon and Modest Magnezone.

  • Annihilape struggles to deal with faster Pokemon with super effective STAB moves like Talonflame, most Dragapult, and faster Taunt users such as Booster Energy Great Tusk and Corviknight.

sets.name: Booster Energy (Speed)
sets.description:
• Bulk Up further boosts Great Tusk's naturally high Attack and Defense stats.
  • Booster Energy lets Great Tusk outspeed Meowscarada, Annihilape, and Corviknight.
  • Knock Off can be used to remove Choice items from Dragapult, Gholdengo, and Magnezone.
  • Great Tusk’s EV spread allows for maximum Attack while still procuring the Speed boost from its Booster Energy. The HP investment increases Great Tusk's bulk and ensures its HP remains odd to have a better matchup against Leech Seed.
  • Due to Great Tusk's low Special Defense stat, it's weak to bulky special attackers such as Weakness Policy or Air Balloon Gholdengo and Skeledirge.
  • Great Tusk is strong against Pokemon that it is able to outspeed due to Booster Energy and should use a damaging move against Choice Specs Iron Bundle, Meowscarada, and Chien Pao.

sets.name: Attack Booster
sets.description:
• Bulk Up allows Great Tusk to reliably beat Choice Band Iron Hands and Choice Band Annihilape. When combined with Taunt, Bulk Up gives Great Tusk a reliable matchup into common Annihilape sets, as the moves work together to disallow Annihilape's own Bulk Up + Taunt combination while playing around Annihilape's Rage Fist and Counter.
  • Close Combat lets Great Tusk reliably beat Slaking, while Knock Off is useful to beat Choice item Magnezone.
  • The Defense EVs let Great Tusk survive Jolly Choice Band Slaking's Giga Impact, while the Speed EVs let it outspeed Adamant Choice Band Slaking.
  • Against non-Air Balloon Skeledirge, Great Tusk has a choice to use either Headlong Rush or Taunt. Headlong Rush OHKOes most Skeledirge sets, like Mental Herb Skeledirge, but has a low chance to OHKO defensive Weakness Policy Skeledirge, which can OHKO in return with Weakness Policy-boosted Blast Burn. However, if Skeledirge uses Will-O-Wisp, Great Tusk's Headlong Rush 2HKOes it. Great Tusk can use Taunt to stop Skeledirge's Will-O-Wisp, but this loses to Skeledirge's Torch Song.
  • If Air Balloon Skeledirge uses Will-O-Wisp on the first turn, Great Tusk has to correctly predict this and use Taunt to win. If Skeledirge does not use Will-O-Wisp, Great Tusk can use Knock Off into Headlong Rush to win. However, if Air Balloon Skeledirge uses Torch Song on the first turn while Great Tusk uses Taunt, Skeledirge would win.
  • Against Magnezone, Great Tusk can use Knock Off into Headlong Rush to play around Choice Specs Magnezone's Hyper Beam.
  • If using Knock Off over Close Combat, Great Tusk should use Headlong Rush twice to 2HKO Jolly Choice Band Slaking; however, against Adamant Choice Band Slaking, Great Tusk should use Bulk Up followed by Headlong Rush twice to win.

sets.name: Choice Scarf
sets.description:
• With maximum Attack and Speed EVs and Choice Scarf, Great Tusk can outspeed and OHKO Meowscarada, non-Speed Booster Energy Iron Bundle, and Chien-Pao.
  • Megahorn is for Brute Bonnet and some Wo-Chien
  • Fire Fang is for Scizor.
  • Head Smash is for Volcarona and Iron Jugulis.
  • Heavy Slam is for some Sylveon.
  • Due to Great Tusk's low Special Defense, it is weak to special attackers like Skeledirge, Speed Booster Energy Iron Bundle, Babiri Berry Sylveon, and Iron Valiant.
  • Since Great Tusk will be locked into an attacking move, opposing Annihilape can set up with Bulk Up and OHKO Great Tusk afterwards.

sets.name: Choice Band
sets.description:
• Heavy Slam is likely to OHKO non-Babiri Berry defensive Sylveon.
  • Head Smash OHKOes Stall Talonflame, Choice Scarf Meowscarada, and bulky Volcarona. However, other variants of these Pokemon can still beat Choice Band Great Tusk.
  • Knock Off 2HKOes non-bulky Magnezone while removing its item as well as OHKOing Farigiraf.
  • Megahorn OHKOes Iron Leaves and non-Protect Espathra.
  • Ice Spinner OHKOs Garchomp and non-defensive Substitute Roaring Moon so Great Tusk need not risk lowering its Defense from hitting Substitute with Close Combat. However, this will lose against defensive Roaring Moon that use Acrobatics turn 1.
  • Using a Jolly nature allows Great Tusk to outspeed and OHKO non-Choice Scarf Gardevoir and Adamant Slaking. Adamant allows it to reliably OHKO non-Babiri Berry defensive Sylveon with Heavy Slam, have a high chance to OHKO non-defensive Azumarill and Scizor with Headlong Rush, and occasionally OHKO Air Balloon Skeledirge with Head Smash.

sets.name: Choice Specs
sets.description:
• Psyshock hits Iron Moth and Clodsire.
  • Thunderbolt hits Corviknight, while Grass Knot is able to OHKO Dondozo.
  • Trick + Disable can reliably beat Weakness Policy Ting-Lu, Clodsire, and non-Mental Herb Corviknight.
  • Against Espathra, Iron Valiant should always use Moonblast for the best chance of winning. Moonblast has a favorable chance to OHKO non-specially defensive variants, which win if they use Calm Mind.
  • If running Trick + Disable, you should be cautious of Skeledirge and Bellibolt because they can beat Iron Valiant after Trick gives them Choice Specs.
